hero.headline: Elgato vs AVerMedia: Which Capture Card Wins?
hero.subheadline: Two capture card giants battle for your streaming setup. Find the right choice for your needs.

sections.content: Elgato and AVerMedia dominate the capture card market for YouTube creators. Both offer quality game capture, but with different strengths in software, features, and price points. This comparison helps you choose the right card for your gaming content.

content.title: Ecosystem Integration
content.description: Works seamlessly with Stream Deck, Wave microphones, and Elgato lighting.

content.title: Build Quality

content.title: Value Pricing

faq.question: Do I need a capture card for PC gaming?
faq.answer: Not for recording your own PC games. OBS can capture directly. Capture cards are for console gaming or dual-PC streaming setups.

faq.question: Which brand has better software?
faq.answer: Elgato's software is more polished and user-friendly. Most creators use OBS anyway, where both brands work well.

faq.question: Can I use these for console streaming?
faq.answer: Yes, that's their primary purpose. Both brands capture PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch footage.

faq.question: Internal or external capture card?
faq.answer: External USB cards are more flexible. Internal PCIe cards have slightly better performance. Choose based on your setup needs.
